metadata.title: Continuous Plankton Recorder Data

creators.name: Science, Sir Alister Hardy Foundation for Ocean

metadata.description:
The Continuous Plankton Recorder is towed on a transect from Alaska to California (until 2004) or to Puget Sound (from 2004). The transect is sampled between 5 and 7 times per year. The transect is divided up into discrete plankton samples, each 18kms long. Every fourth collected sample (and every sequential Alaskan shelf sample) is processed for hard-shelled phytoplankton and mesozooplankton (principally crustacea). Organisms are identified to the highest practicable taxonomic level and levels of abundance are recorded for each taxon. All samples are archived. The data are stored as counts of each taxon together with time, date and location of collection of the mid-point of the sample. 

Please also see Metadata ID 2015 for another north Pacific CPR project.  

[ An EVOS GEM project ]
metadata.notes:
Purpose: Data were collected to provide baseline information of plankton populations on large spatial scales, and to monitor the distributions through time.

Status: In Progress

Maintenance frequency: Continually

Access constraints: Permission of Contributor required.

Use constraints: Acknowledgement of data source publication required.
